procedures.name: Insulin-induced Hypoglycemia
procedures.label: Hypoglycemia Induction
procedures.description: Procedure to induce hypoglycemia using an intravenous (IV) insulin infusion until plasma glucose level reaches <60 mg/dL.

procedures.name: Nasal Glucagon Administration
procedures.label: Nasal Glucagon Admin
procedures.description: Administration of 3 mg LY900018, a powder formulation of human glucagon, via a single-use nasal dosing device.

procedures.name: Intramuscular Glucagon Administration
procedures.label: IM Glucagon Admin
procedures.description: Administration of 1 mg reconstituted glucagon (GlucaGen) via intramuscular injection.

procedures.name: Venipuncture
procedures.label: Blood Draw
procedures.description: Collection of venous blood samples for laboratory analysis, including pharmacokinetics (PK), pharmacodynamics (PD), clinical chemistry, hematology, serology, HbA1c, and genetic analysis.

code.decode: Collection of venous blood by venipuncture

procedures.name: Urine Sample Collection
procedures.label: Urine Collection
procedures.description: Collection of urine samples for urinalysis, pregnancy testing, and drug screening.

procedures.name: Vital Signs Measurement
procedures.label: Vital Signs
procedures.description: Measurement of supine blood pressure, pulse rate, and body temperature at specified time points.

procedures.name: 12-lead Electrocardiogram
procedures.label: ECG
procedures.description: Recording of the heart's electrical activity using a single or triplicate 12-lead ECG.

code.decode: Electrocardiogram, routine ECG with at least 12 leads; with interpretation and report

procedures.name: Bedside Plasma Glucose Monitoring
procedures.label: Bedside PG Monitoring
procedures.description: Frequent monitoring of plasma glucose (PG) levels for safety during the hypoglycemia induction procedure and post-treatment.

procedures.name: Nasal Inspection
procedures.label: Nasal Inspection
procedures.description: Visual inspection of the nasal passages before and after study treatment administration.

procedures.name: Injection-Site Assessment
procedures.label: Injection Site Assessment
procedures.description: Assessment of the injection site for patients receiving intramuscular glucagon (IMG).

procedures.name: Height and Weight Measurement
procedures.label: Height and Weight
procedures.description: Measurement of patient's height at screening and weight before hypoglycemia induction.

procedures.name: Edinburgh Hypoglycemia Scale Assessment
procedures.label: Hypoglycemia Scale
procedures.description: Administration of the Edinburgh Hypoglycemia Scale questionnaire to evaluate recovery from clinical symptoms of hypoglycemia.

procedures.name: Intravenous Glucose Supplementation
procedures.label: IV Glucose Rescue
procedures.description: Administration of intravenous (IV) glucose as a rescue treatment if the patient experiences signs and symptoms of severe hypoglycemia requiring intervention.

medicalDevices.name: Nasal Dosing Device
medicalDevices.label: Nasal Glucagon Device
medicalDevices.description: A user-friendly, single-use, nasal dosing device that delivers 3 mg glucagon powder (LY900018) for absorption through the nasal mucosa.

medicalDevices.name: Continuous Subcutaneous Insulin Infusion Pump
medicalDevices.label: CSII Pump
medicalDevices.description: An insulin pump used by some patients for their daily insulin therapy.

medicalDevices.name: Syringe and Needle
medicalDevices.label: Syringe/Needle
medicalDevices.description: Implied device for reconstitution and intramuscular injection of GlucaGen.

medicalDevices.name: Bedside Glucose Meter
medicalDevices.label: Glucose Meter
medicalDevices.description: Implied device for bedside plasma glucose (PG) monitoring.

medicalDevices.name: Intravenous Infusion System
medicalDevices.label: IV System
medicalDevices.description: Implied system including an infusion pump for the administration of intravenous insulin.
